title: What's the typeface in the new Triumph logo?
content:
Can anybody tell what font is used for this logo, just the word triumph...??

Thanks Nick

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo%20RAT.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081701/http:/typophile.com/files/logo%20RAT.jpg) | 14.87 KB |
author: Nickmulley

comments.content:
It's come up before... [http://typophile.com/node/7605](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081701/http:/typophile.com/node/7605 "http://typophile.com/node/7605")  
Albertus may be your best bet.

No it hasnt, thats the old version...

The one im after is the new version...

Ok i have done... I already know its similar to that, i was just wondering if there was a closer one... As that isnt the actual font, and the logo seems to modified to be that originally...

Thanks Tho...
I doubt this was modified from an existing font. Custom drawn is more likely. The suggestions given are the closest I know of.

Thats great anyways...

Ive made one up using a cross between the two typefaces and its a pretty good version.

Thanks for all ur help guys n gals...

Nick
Actually, to me at least anyway, it seems like a customized and really bold version of Baker Signet would nail down that Triumph lettering. I could be wrong though.
